definition: solid as a boulder (idiom); absolutely secure/rock-firm and unyielding
strong/solid/firm/unyielding/resolute
as/as if/such as
firm/stable/rock
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
surname Shi
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: He's been such a stable guy in the league, like a rock.
sentences.chinese: 在联盟里，他非常稳定，坚如磐石。

sentences.english: My body had withered away to a mere 65 pounds but my faith and will were rock solid.
sentences.chinese: 我的体重下降到只有65磅，但我的信念却坚如磐石。

sentences.english: What turns a stone-hard woman into the blubbering mess I see before me?
sentences.chinese: 是什么把眼前这个坚如磐石的女人哭成了泪人？

sentences.english: But Ireland and Spain had what seemed to be rock-solid fiscal positions (see charts).
sentences.chinese: 但爱尔兰和西班牙的财政状况看上去坚如磐石。

sentences.english: The solidarity among China's various nationalities is as firm as a rock.
sentences.chinese: 中国各族人民之间的团结坚如磐石。

sentences.english: China-Pakistan relations are as firm as a rock and have withstood the tests of time.
sentences.chinese: 中巴关系坚如磐石，历久弥新。

sentences.english: Or you’re rock solid, no change ever happening.
sentences.chinese: 又或者你的性格坚如磐石，永不改变。

sentences.english: China-Pakistan relationship is strong and solid, like a rock standing firm despite the passage of time.
sentences.chinese: 中巴关系坚如磐石，历久弥新。

sentences.english: I am hard to stay and wait a constant emotion such as the huge rock ground.
sentences.chinese: 坚如磐石地守候一份不变的情感。

definition: invulnerable, indestructible, impregnable
as solid as rock (idiom); as sure as houses
boulder
Panshi county level city in Jilin prefecture 吉林, Jilin province
secure as a city protected by a wall of metal and a moat of boiling water (idiom)/well fortified/invulnerable to attack
to become more resolute with the passing of time (idiom)
firm/firmly/hard/stable
to sway/to waver/to rock/to rattle/to destabilize/to pose a challenge to
steadfast/inalienable
steady as Mt Tai/as safe as houses
no stronghold one cannot overcome (idiom); to conquer every obstacle/nothing one can't do/to carry everything before one
to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
copper wall, iron bastion (idiom); impenetrable defense
to stick to sth without change (idiom); to persevere
firm/unswerving/loyal to the end
unswerving from start to finish (idiom)
to collapse/to fall apart
